title: Input Validation Errors
description:
Create a validation system using custom error types.

## Requirements

1. Define a `ValidationError` enum with cases:
   - `empty` - input is empty
   - `tooShort(minimum: Int)` - input too short
   - `tooLong(maximum: Int)` - input too long
   - `invalidCharacter(Character)` - contains invalid character

2. Create a `validatePassword(_ password: String) throws` function that:
   - Throws `empty` if password is empty
   - Throws `tooShort(minimum: 8)` if less than 8 characters
   - Throws `tooLong(maximum: 32)` if more than 32 characters
   - Throws `invalidCharacter` if it contains a space
   - Returns Void if valid

3. Test with valid and invalid passwords

## Expected Output

```
"SecurePass123" is valid
"short" error: Password must be at least 8 characters
"" error: Password cannot be empty
```

testCases.description: ValidationError should have tooShort case with minimum
Empty password should throw empty error
testCases.assertion: do { try validatePassword(""); false } catch ValidationError.empty { true } catch { false }

testCases.description: Short password should throw tooShort error
testCases.assertion: do { try validatePassword("short"); false } catch ValidationError.tooShort { true } catch { false }

hints: Use enum with associated values: case tooShort(minimum: Int)
Conform to LocalizedError and implement errorDescription
Check conditions in order: empty first, then length, then characters
